question_1.question: What is the first step to deploy the TimeXtender Application Server on Azure?

options.option_b: Navigate to the TimeXtender Application Server Azure Deployment

question_1.explanation: The first step is to sign in to the Azure portal at https://portal.azure.com before deploying the TimeXtender Application Server.

question_2.question: How do you begin the deployment of the TimeXtender Application Server in Azure?

options.option_a: Configure your desired properties for the Virtual Machine
options.option_b: Click Create after navigating to the TimeXtender Application Server in the search bar
options.option_c: Connect to the Virtual Machine using RDP
options.option_d: Enter the credentials for the virtual machine

question_2.explanation: To begin deployment, you navigate to the TimeXtender Application Server in the Azure portal and click 'Create'.

question_3.question: What should you do after the TimeXtender Application Server has been deployed?

options.option_b: Navigate to the Virtual machine & Click Connect
options.option_c: Configure your desired properties for another Virtual Machine
options.option_d: Sign out of the Azure portal

question_3.explanation: After deployment, you should navigate to the Virtual Machine and click 'Connect' to proceed with the setup.

question_4.question: What is the purpose of downloading the RDP file when setting up the TimeXtender Application Server on Azure?

options.option_a: To install TimeXtender and ODX Server
options.option_b: To configure the properties of the Virtual Machine
options.option_c: To connect to the Virtual Machine
options.option_d: To create a backup of the Virtual Machine

question_4.explanation: The RDP file is used to remotely connect to the Virtual Machine after the deployment is complete.
